The Fazer Language

Fazer is a high-performance, interpreted language designed for Red Teaming, OSINT, and Rapid Prototyping. It combines the ease of Python with the raw power of native system access.

  • Native Modules: No dependencies required. Crypto, HTTP, Sockets, and Graphics are built-in.
  • Red Team Ready: Built-in shellcode injection, memory dumping, and network scanning.
  • Safe & Secure: Encrypted source code (.fzc) and sandbox capabilities.
  • Cross-Platform: Runs on Windows, Linux, and macOS.

Downloads & Links

Get the latest binaries and source code.

Download Installer (Windows .exe)

Repositories

  • GitHub: github.com/viced-1920/fazer-lang
  • NPM: npmjs.com/package/fazer-lang

Installation Guide

Option 1: Windows Installer

Download the .exe installer above. It will automatically add `fazer` to your PATH and install the Fazer Studio editor.

Option 2: Via NPM (Linux/Mac/Windows)

If you have Node.js installed, this is the fastest way to get the CLI.

npm install -g fazer-lang
fazer --version

Option 3: Build from Source

git clone https://github.com/viced-1920/fazer-lang
cd fazer-lang
npm install
node fazer.js my_script.fz

Syntax & Core Concepts

Variables

Fazer uses := for initialization. Variables are immutable by default unless declared with `mut`.

# Immutable
x := 10
# x = 20  <-- Error!

# Mutable
mut y := 10
y = 20    <-- OK

# Strings
name := "Fazer"
path := 'C:\Windows\System32'

Lists & Objects

Important: Object properties and list elements cannot be assigned directly (e.g., `obj.x = 1`). Use `set()`.

# Lists
mut list := [1, 2, 3]
list.push(4)
println(list[0])

# Objects
mut obj := { x: 10, y: 20 }
set(obj, "x", 99)   # Correct way to modify properties
println(obj.x)

Control Flow

Conditionals

if x > 10 ->
    println("Big")
else if x == 10 ->
    println("Equal")
else ->
    println("Small")
end

Loops

mut i := 0
while i < 5 ->
    println("Count: " + i)
    i = i + 1
end

# Iterating lists
for item in list ->
    println(item)
end

Error Handling

try ->
    data := read_file("missing.txt")
end
catch e ->
    println("Error: " + e)
end

Builtin Functions (Global)

Always available without import.

print(msg) / println(msg) Output text to stdout. `println` adds a newline.
ask(prompt) Read input from stdin. Pauses execution until user types.
sleep(ms) Pause execution for `ms` milliseconds.
len(obj) Return length of string or array.
set(obj, key, value) Set a property on an object or index in an array.
str_sub(s, start, end) Substring extraction.

System Module (sys)

Interact with the operating system.

sys.spawn(cmd, args, opts) Spawn a child process. Returns object with `.kill()`, `.stdin`.
sys.kill(pid) Kill a process by PID.
sys.ps(script) Execute PowerShell script and return output as string.
sys.ps_json(script) Execute PowerShell and parse output as JSON (useful for structured data).
sys.is_admin() Returns true if the script is running with elevated privileges.
sys.write_stdin(pid, data) Write data to the standard input of a running process.
sys.mem_dump(pid, file) Dump process memory to file (Requires Admin).
sys.dll_load(path, method, signature) Load a .NET assembly/DLL into the current process via FFI.
sys.platform() / sys.arch() Return OS name (win32/linux) and architecture (x64/arm64).

FileSystem Module (fs)

File and directory manipulation.

fs.read(path) Read file content as string.
fs.write(path, content) Write string content to file (overwrites).
fs.append(path, content) Append string content to end of file.
fs.exists(path) Check if file or directory exists.
fs.delete(path) Delete a file or directory.
fs.mkdir(path) Create a directory.
fs.list(path) List files in a directory.
fs.stat(path) Get file stats (size, created, modified, is_dir).
fs.copy(src, dest) Copy a file.
fs.move(src, dest) Move/Rename a file.

Network Module (net)

Low-level and high-level networking.

net.connect(host, port) Test TCP connectivity. Returns true/false.
net.server(port, handler) Start a TCP server. Handler receives socket object.
net.tcp_client(host, port, onData) Create a raw TCP client.
net.udp_socket(port, onMsg) Create a UDP socket for sending/receiving packets.
net.download(url, path) Download a file from URL to path.
net.public_ip() Fetch external IP address via API.
net.dns(domain) Resolve A records for a domain.
net.interfaces() List all network interfaces and IPs.

HTTP Module (fetch)

Modern HTTP client requests.

fetch(url, opts) Perform HTTP request. `opts` can include method, headers, body. Returns { status, text, json, headers }. 
resp := fetch("https://api.example.com", {
    method: "POST",
    headers: { "Content-Type": "application/json" },
    body: '{"key": "value"}'
})
println(resp.json.key)

OSINT & HTML Parser

Tools for Open Source Intelligence gathering.

OSINT Helpers

osint.whois(domain) Perform a WHOIS lookup.
osint.dork_url(query) Generate a Google Dork URL for the query.
osint.ua() Return a random User-Agent string.

HTML Parsing (html)

html.extract_links(source) Return a list of all `href` attributes in the HTML.
html.extract_emails(source) Regex scan for email addresses in the text.
html.strip_tags(source) Remove all HTML tags, returning only text content.

Security Module (security)

File system security and privacy tools.

security.shred(path, passes) Securely delete a file (overwrite multiple times then unlink).
security.lock_folder(path) Hide and lock a folder using OS attributes (+h +s +r).
security.unlock_folder(path) Unlock and unhide a folder.
security.encrypt_file(path, key) Encrypt a file in place using AES-256.
security.decrypt_file(path, key) Decrypt a file in place.
security.monitor(path, callback) Watch a directory for changes. Callback receives event details.
security.steg_hide(image_path, text, output_path) Hide text inside an image (Steganography).
security.steg_reveal(image_path) Reveal hidden text from an image.

Cryptography Module (crypto)

Industry standard cryptography.

crypto.hash(algo, data) Compute hash. Algo: 'md5', 'sha1', 'sha256', 'sha512'.
crypto.hmac(algo, key, data) Compute HMAC.
crypto.aes_encrypt(key, text) Encrypt text using AES-256-CBC. Key must be 32 bytes. Returns `iv:ciphertext`.
crypto.aes_decrypt(key, cipher) Decrypt `iv:ciphertext` string.
crypto.rsa_keypair() Generate a new RSA keypair { public, private }.
crypto.rsa_encrypt(pub_key, data) Encrypt data with public key.
crypto.rsa_decrypt(priv_key, data) Decrypt data with private key.
crypto.sign(priv_key, data) Sign data with private key.
crypto.verify(pub_key, data, signature) Verify signature with public key.

Flux Adaptive Zone Entropy Rotation (FAZER) Crypto System

Fazer Exclusive

A unique, military-grade 512-bit block cipher designed specifically for Fazer. It utilizes the Flux Adaptive Zone Entropy Rotation (FAZER) algorithm, featuring:

  • 512-bit Block Size (4x larger than AES).
  • Key-Dependent Adaptive S-Boxes (Unique per key).
  • 16-Round Feistel Network for perfect reversibility.
  • Flux Layer (XOR), Zone Substitution, and Entropy Rotation.
crypto.fazer_encrypt(key, text) Encrypts text using FZ-512. Returns a hex string containing the random IV and ciphertext.
crypto.fazer_decrypt(key, hex) Decrypts a FZ-512 encrypted hex string. Returns the original text. 
key := "MySecretKey"
cipher := crypto.fazer_encrypt(key, "Sensitive Data")
println(cipher)
original := crypto.fazer_decrypt(key, cipher)

Implant Module (Red Team)

Warning: For authorized testing only.

implant.beacon(url, interval_ms) Start a background beacon that sends system info to `url` every `interval_ms`.
implant.persist(method) Install persistence. Method: "startup" (LNK file) or "registry" (HKCU Run).
wifi.scan() Scan for nearby WiFi networks (SSID, Signal).
wifi.dump(ssid) Dump cleartext password for saved WiFi profile (Admin required).

Database (db)

Simple JSON-based key-value store for persistence.

db.open(path) Load or create a JSON database file.
db.set(key, value) Save a value.
db.get(key) Retrieve a value.
db.save() Flush changes to disk.

Concurrency & Workers

Multithreading and Async operations.

worker.spawn(file_path, data) Start a true OS thread running `file_path`. Returns worker handle.
worker.post(msg) Send message from worker to parent.
chan(capacity) Create a buffered channel for coroutine communication.
send(ch, val) / recv(ch) Send/Receive data on a channel (Async).

Struct (Binary)

Pack/Unpack binary data (like Python struct).

struct.pack(fmt, v1, v2...) Return Buffer. Format chars: b/B (8-bit), h/H (16-bit), i/I (32-bit), f (float), d (double), s (string).
struct.unpack(fmt, buffer) Return list of values from buffer.

CLI Tools

Built-in command line tools available via `fazer `.

Crypto & Security

keygen [len] Generate a secure cryptographic key. Default 32 bytes (256-bit). Use 64 for FAZER-512.
hash <algo> <text> Compute hash (md5, sha1, sha256).
b64 <enc|dec> <text> Base64 encode/decode.

Network / OSINT

geo <ip/domain> Geolocate an IP address or domain.
scan <host> [ports] Scan open ports on a target.
whois <domain> Perform a WHOIS lookup.

WebAssembly (wasm)

Load and run WebAssembly modules.

wasm.load(path, imports) Load a `.wasm` file. Returns { instance, module, exports }.
wasm.validate(bytes) Check if byte array is valid WASM code.

Webview (GUI)

Create modern UIs with HTML/CSS/JS.

webview.start(config, callback) Start UI server. Config: { root: "ui_folder", port: 8080, width, height }.
webview.send(type, data) Send Server-Sent Event (SSE) to connected frontend.

Graphics (GFX)

2D/3D Game Engine using WebGL/Canvas backend.

gfx.init(title, w, h) Initialize a 2D window.
gfx.init3d(title, w, h) Initialize a 3D window (WebGL).
gfx.loop(callback) Start the game loop. Callback runs every frame.
gfx.rect(x, y, w, h, color) Draw a rectangle. Color is hex string.
gfx.text(str, x, y, color) Draw text overlay.
gfx.load_image(key, path) Load image asset.
gfx.image(key, x, y) Draw loaded image.
gfx.load_sound(key, path) Load audio asset.
gfx.play_sound(key, loop) Play audio.

Physics (Phys)

Math helpers for games and simulations.

phys.dist(x1, y1, x2, y2) Euclidean distance between two points.
phys.angle(x1, y1, x2, y2) Angle in radians between two points.
phys.clamp(val, min, max) Constrain a value between min and max.
phys.lerp(a, b, t) Linear interpolation between a and b by t (0.0 - 1.0).
phys.aabb(r1, r2) Check collision between two rectangles {x,y,w,h}.

3D Engine Library (engine3d)

High-level 3D abstractions. Usage: `import engine3d`

engine3d.Vec3(x, y, z) Create a 3D vector object.
engine3d.Camera(x, y, z) Create an FPS camera.
engine3d.create_cube_mesh(id, color) Generate a cube mesh for the renderer.
engine3d.aabb_intersect(p1, s1, p2, s2) 3D AABB collision detection.

Isometric Library (iso)

Isometric projection helpers. Usage: `import iso`

iso.to_screen(x, y, z) Convert grid coordinates to screen (x, y) for drawing.
iso.to_world(screen_x, screen_y) Convert screen coordinates back to grid (picking).

Crypto (FAZER-512)

Native encryption, hashing, and the unique FAZER-512 cipher.

crypto.fazer_encrypt(key, text) Encrypt text using FAZER-512 (Custom Feistel Network). Key must be 64 bytes (512-bit).
crypto.fazer_decrypt(key, hex) Decrypt FAZER-512 hex string.
crypto.aes_encrypt(key, text) Standard AES-256 encryption.
crypto.hash(algo, text) Hash string (algo: 'md5', 'sha1', 'sha256').
crypto.random_bytes(n) Generate n cryptographically strong random bytes (hex).

CLI Commands

Built-in tools available via `fazer <cmd>`.

fazer keygen [bits] Generate a secure random hex key. Default 256-bit, use 64 for 512-bit FAZER keys.
fazer support Open the donation/support page.
fazer geo <ip> IP Geolocation lookup.
fazer scan <host> <ports> TCP Port scanner.

Advanced Examples

1. Simple TCP Server

import net

fn handler(socket) ->
    println("New Client!")
    socket.write("Hello from Fazer\n")
    socket.close()
end

println("Listening on 8080...")
net.server(8080, handler)

2. File Encryptor

import security
import fs

key := "SecretKey12345678901234567890123" # 32 bytes
file := "secret.txt"

fs.write(file, "Top Secret Data")
security.encrypt_file(file, key)
println("File Encrypted!")

3. Web Scraper

import fetch
import html

resp := fetch("https://example.com")
links := html.extract_links(resp.text)

for link in links ->
    println("Found: " + link)
end
